ngiemboon: Mbetsaleyɛɛ la lɔgɔ peláŋ manûa ńkwóon kʉ̌b; efʉ̀ʼ na gwǒŋ yelÿò laa lemaʼá pwó yépʉ́a né tsěm, efʉ̀ʼ na gwǒŋ yekʉ́ gwɔ́ tàʼ lemaʼá pwó né tsěm, acú gwɔ́ tàʼ lemaʼá pwó né tsěm.
en: Bezalel   made the ark of acacia wood, forty-five inches long, twenty-seven inches wide, and twenty-seven inches high.  # 37:1 Lit two and a half cubits its length, one and a half cubits its width, and one and a half cubits its height

ngiemboon: À la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ gie á lʉ́ate, ńzye nzème tsoló, mbɔɔ nzème pǐ, ḿbiŋ ńdɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte mmó, ńdɔg ńkéle ncwò kʉ̌b.
en: He overlaid it with pure gold inside and out and made a gold molding all around it.

ngiemboon: À la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte mekwáŋ lekùɔ, ńnéŋe na mezẅé lekùɔ, mekwáŋ mémbʉ́a gwɔ́ na tàʼ nkwɔʼɔ́, mekwáŋ mémbʉ́a gíŋe ńgwɔ́ na wetsɔ́ nkwɔʼɔ́.
en: He cast four gold rings for it, for its four feet, two rings on one side and two rings on the other side.

ngiemboon: À la lɔgɔ peláŋ manûa ńnyɛte mepáŋte mémbʉ́a, ḿbiŋ ńdɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ḿbwoon.
en: He made poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.

ngiemboon: À la shÿɔ́g mepáŋte tsɛ̀ɛ mekwáŋ, mie ée na menkwɔʼɔ́ kʉ̌b, lélɔg ńkaa yɛ̌ kʉ̌b.
en: He inserted the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark for carrying the ark.

ngiemboon: À la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ gie á lʉ́ate ńnyɛte nzìŋe yɛ̌; efʉ̀ʼ na gwǒŋ yelÿò laa lemaʼá pwó yépʉ́a né tsěm, agwǒŋ yekʉ́ gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ tàʼ lemaʼá pwó né tsěm.
en: He made a mercy seat of pure gold, forty-five inches long and twenty-seven inches wide.

ngiemboon: À la lɔg ndùlɔ̀ɔn tá ńtsó tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńdɔg nyɛte mekɛlẅimbeŋ mémbʉ́a ńtÿɔ́gɔ na metwó mémbʉ́a ndùm nzìŋe,
en: He made two cherubim of gold; he made them of hammered work at the two ends of the mercy seat,

ngiemboon: À la tÿɔ́gɔ tàʼ kɛlẅimbeŋ na tàʼa twó, ńgíŋe ńtÿɔ́gɔ tàʼ kɛlẅimbeŋ na yetsɔ́ twó; à la nyɛte mekɛlẅimbeŋ lé nzìŋe kʉ̌b, tà á gwɔ́ pɔ́ na ntí gie mekɛlẅimbeŋ mémbʉ́a pâ nzìŋe kʉ̌b pú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tàʼa mmó la.
en: one cherub at one end and one cherub at the other end. At each end, he made a cherub of one piece with the mercy seat.

ngiemboon: Mekɛlẅimbeŋ la siŋ membabá mɔ́b ńnáa tÿǒ, ńdɔg ḿbwoon nzìŋe. Tàʼ tyé mvfò wetsɔ̌; mekɛlẅimbeŋ la sele shÿó wɔ́b, ńne ńdɔgɔ ńdíe nzìŋe.
en: They had wings spread out. They faced each other and covered the mercy seat with their wings. The faces of the cherubim were looking toward the mercy seat.

ngiemboon: Á la cʉa púʼu, Mbetsaleyɛɛ lɔgɔ peláŋa manûa ńnyɛte tápèle; efʉ̀ʼ na gwǒŋ yelÿò laa lemaʼá pwó yépʉ́a, agwǒŋ yekʉ́ gwɔ́ tàʼ lemaʼá pwó, acú piŋ ńgwɔ́ tàʼ lemaʼá pwó né tsěm.
en: He   constructed the table of acacia wood, thirty-six inches long, eighteen inches wide, and twenty-seven inches high.  # 37:10 Lit two cubits its length, one cubit its width, and one and a half cubits its height

ngiemboon: À la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ gie á lʉ́ate ḿbwoon, ḿbiŋ ńdɔgɔ tsɔ́ pàga mmó gie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte ńkéle mé ngʉ̀ŋe mɛ̌.
en: He overlaid it with pure gold and made a gold molding all around it.

ngiemboon: À la nyɛte púɔ mepeláŋ mie lepfòm gẅiin ntyě lɔ̌ɔn pwó ńdɔg ńkéle mengʉ̀ŋe wɛ̌ tápèle, ḿbiŋ ńdɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ḿbwoon.
en: He made a three-inch   frame all around it and made a gold molding all around its frame.

ngiemboon: À la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte mekwáŋ lekùɔ; ńnéŋ mekwáŋ na mezẅé lekùɔ mie é lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ mekwò mɛ̌ lekùɔ.
en: He cast four gold rings for it and attached the rings to the four corners at its four legs.

ngiemboon: Mekwáŋ laa na mezẅé tÿɔ́ʼte, á ngʉ̀ŋe mekwò tápèle; à la shÿɔ́gte mepáŋte mie mé ge lɔg kaa tápèle pɔ́ mǒ.
en: The rings were next to the frame as holders for the poles to carry the table.

ngiemboon: À la lɔgɔ peláŋa manûa ńnyɛte mepáŋte, ḿbiŋ ńdɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ḿbwoon; é la kẅéte lékaa tápèle.
en: He made the poles for carrying the table from acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.

ngiemboon: À la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ gie á lʉ́ate, ńnyɛte sé shúm páʼ: pàga káŋ, mbɔɔ mentúʼ, mbɔɔ metétɔ́ʼ, ńgÿo púɔ megʉ̌ lélɔg ńnuŋe pwɔʼ we melùʼ.
en: He also made the utensils that would be on the table out of pure gold: its plates and cups, as well as its bowls and pitchers for pouring drink offerings.

ngiemboon: Mbetsaleyɛɛ la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ gie á lʉ́ate ńnyɛte letÿɔgɔ́ melâm: à la lɔg ndùlɔ̀ɔn ńtsó tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ tá ńdɔg ńnyɛte. Letsìŋ sɛ̌ pɔ́ nkwoŋ wɛ̌, mentúʼ mɛ̌, membaŋ mɛ̌, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo metôtǒ la gwɔ́ pɔ́ na tàʼa mmó wémɔʼɔ́.
en: Then   he made the lampstand out of pure hammered gold. He made it all of one piece: its base and shaft, its ornamental cups, and its buds and petals.

ngiemboon: Mefagá ntɔgɔ́ la kẅɛɛ na nkwoŋ wɛ̌, mefagá méntá gwɔ́ na tàʼ nkwɔʼɔ́, e mé méntá gíŋe ńgwɔ́ na wetsɔ́ nkwɔʼɔ́ yɛ̌ mmó gie mé tÿɔ́gɔ melâm mǒ.
en: Six branches extended from its sides, three branches of the lampstand from one side and three branches of the lampstand from the other side.

ngiemboon: Á laa na sɛ̌ lefagá wɔ́ɔ, mentúʼ méntá mie é sẅé mentɔ̌ɔn tÿǒ gie mé tóŋo lê amaŋndíe gwɔ́ mǒ, ńgÿo membaŋ mɛ̌ mbɔɔ metôtǒ.
en: There were three cups shaped like almond blossoms, each with a bud and petals, on one branch, and three cups shaped like almond blossoms, each with a bud and petals, on the next branch. It was this way for the six branches that extended from the lampstand.

ngiemboon: Nkwòŋ we tsetsɛ̀ɛ we mmó gie mé tÿɔ́gɔ lâm mǒ, é la gẅiin mentúʼ mie é sẅé ntɔ̌ɔn tÿǒ gie mé tóŋo lê amaŋndíe lekùɔ, ńgÿo membaŋ mɛ̌ mbɔɔ metôtǒ.
en: There were four cups shaped like almond blossoms on the lampstand shaft along with its buds and petals.

ngiemboon: Tàʼ mbàŋ laa tsìŋe ssé na melùŋmvfò mefagá mémbʉ́a mie é fó na nkwoŋ we tsetsɛ̀ɛ, tàʼ lefagá gʉa né na gwoŋó pwó tʉ̀, setsɔ́ gee na gwoŋó pwó kyɛ̀bɛ, á la gwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu na mefagá ntɔgɔ́ mie ée na mmó gie mé tÿɔ́gɔ melâm mǒ.
en: For the six branches that extended from it, a bud was under the first pair of branches from it, a bud under the second pair of branches from it, and a bud under the third pair of branches from it.

ngiemboon: Membaŋ mɛ̌ lâ mefagá mɛ̌ la gwɔ́ pɔ́ na tàʼa pàga mmó yémɔʼɔ́; sɛ̌ shúm ntsèm gwɔ́ pɔ́ né tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ gie mé lɔ̌g ndùlɔ̀ɔn ńtsó, á tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ gie á lʉ́ate.
en: Their buds and branches were of one piece with it. All of it was a single hammered piece of pure gold.

ngiemboon: À la nyɛte melâm sɔɔnmbʉ́a, ńnyɛte shúm sie mé tÿɔ́gɔ melâm mǒ; ńdɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ gie á lʉ́ate, ńnyɛte mesẅìbe mɛ̌ ńgÿo metétɔ́ʼ lɔg ńdyɛ́te pfó.
en: He also made its seven lamps, snuffers, and firepans of pure gold.

ngiemboon: À la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ gie á lʉ́ate é mekílò móm ntá, ńnyɛte metÿɔgɔ́ melâm, mbɔɔ shúm sé ntsèm.
en: He made it and all its utensils of seventy-five pounds   of pure gold.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼ la kuʼ Mbetsaleyɛɛ lɔgɔ peláŋa manûa, ńnyɛte jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ lélɔg ńtuɔ lìi; efʉ̀ʼ na gwǒŋ yelÿò laa tàʼ lemaʼá pwó, agwǒŋ yekʉ́ gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ tàʼ lemaʼá pwó; menkwɔʼɔ́ mɛ̌ gẅiin pɔ́ tàʼ fʉ̀ʼ, acú piŋ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ lemaʼá pwó sépʉ́a. Mendóŋ mie ée mǒ piŋ ḿbú ńdaa pɔ́ mǒ, é cʉ́ʼ ḿbú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tàʼ.
en: He   made the altar of incense out of acacia wood. It was square, eighteen inches long and eighteen inches wide; it was thirty-six inches high.  # 37:25 Lit a cubit its length, a cubit its width, and two cubits its height Its horns were of one piece with it.

ngiemboon: À la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ gie á lʉ́ate, ḿbwoon ńdɔg ńkéle ndùm yɛ̌, mbɔɔ mengʉ̀ŋe mɛ̌ pâ mendóŋ mie ée mǒ, ńdɔg ńkéle; à la gíŋe ńdɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte tsɔ̌ tÿɔ́ʼte, ńdɔg ńkéle mengʉ̀ŋe mɛ̌.
en: He overlaid it, its top, all around its sides, and its horns with pure gold. Then he made a gold molding all around it.

ngiemboon: À la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte mekwáŋ mémbʉ́a, éshÿɔ́gɔ na menkwɔʼɔ́ lenuŋé pwɔʼ ŋwɛ́ ntsèm, á na ngʉ̀ŋe. Páʼ mé ge shÿɔ́gte mepáŋte tsɛ̀ɛ mekwáŋ lélɔg ńkaa.
en: He made two gold rings for it under the molding on two of its sides; he put these on opposite sides of it to be holders for the poles to carry it with.

ngiemboon: À la lɔgɔ peláŋa manûa ńnyɛte mepáŋte, ḿbiŋ ńdɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ḿbwoon.
en: He made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.

ngiemboon: À la nyɛte mevɛ́ lɔg ńzɔ́ʼ, é me ndʉalʉ̌a, ńgÿo lìi té lɔ̌ʼ gie gyě kwɔ́ʼ; à la gÿo kwaʼ ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ panyɛte laméndɔ̀ɔn gÿo yɔ́b púʼu.
en: He also made the holy anointing oil and the pure, fragrant, and expertly blended incense.
